name: Erdős–Ulam problem
summary: The Erdős–Ulam problem asks whether a set of points in the plane can be both topologically dense and have all pairwise distances be rational numbers. It is an open problem, but a negative answer (meaning no such set exists) is expected to follow from the Bombieri–Lang conjecture or the abc conjecture.
head: A set \(S\) in the plane (\(\mathbb{R}^{2}\)) has the property that for any two points \(p_{i},p_{j}\in S\), their Euclidean distance \(d(p_{i},p_{j})\) is a rational number.
tail: The set \(S\) is not a topologically dense set in the plane (meaning its closure is not the entire plane).
